creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: abstracted image of woman's head with eyes and nose delineated; white arcs separating colored planes--browns, grey, mottled greens, khaki, orange and brown
inscription: Bottom, in pencil: [Woman in Bagdad] [Tōshi Yoshida 1954]
markings: LLC: Red artist\'s seal [吉田[?]] {Yoshida no in}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Woman in Bagdad
